result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DAVID W STEINMETZ

defendant.name: STEINMETZ, DAVID W
defendant.address: 301 Washington St, C/O Oconto Cty Jail, Oconto, WI 54153

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Second appearance on November 22, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Oconto Cty Jail)

ADDRESS INFO for DAVID W STEINMETZ
Current: 301 Washington St, C/O Oconto Cty Jail, Oconto, WI 54153 United States  (Effective: 10-25-2022)
Prior: 301 Washington St, Oconto, WI 54153 United States
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:10 AM David W. Steinmetz in custody, by video. Attorney Matt McElroy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom.  Court calls 22CF185 and 22TR881. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on the traffic cases. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. 

Court adjourned at 9:13 AM

Court will set for Status of Counsel on November 22, 2022 at 8:45 AM.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely - emailed to the Oconto Cty Jail along with the criminal complaint
Per MP in the DA's office, Agent Chris Miller called to inform them that the defendant is in the Oconto County Jail on new charges.
